DOC.HEAD: Arson Fire Destroys Planned Parenthood Clinic
DOC.TEXT: A fire set under cover of darkness heavily damaged a Planned Parenthood clinic Friday, a police official said. There were no injuries. Firefighters and police were called to the clinic near an intersection with Interstate 70 in this city just east of Kansas City at 3:15 a.m., said Sgt. Al Neinas. The fire was confined to the building's lobby, which was destroyed. A flammable liquid was used to start the fire, Neinas said. Investigators did not have suspects or a motive, he said. Attacks on the clinic, which does not provide abortions, have escalated recently, according to Patty Brous, director of development for Planned Parenthood of Kansas City. A shotgun was fired through a window and a fire was set outside the clinic, which has been the target of picketing, Brous said. The clinic provides family planning services, birth control, pregnancy tests and treatment of sexual diseases.
